reviews.sentence: Family wedding trip. Room was comfortable and met our expectations. Hotel staff was very accommodating. The hotel location is great. close walking distance to shopping and a variety of restaurant options. Overall a great experience. Only thing I did not care for was the in room minibar. The beverages in it were overpriced. Would have preferred a small refrigerator to store our own beverages.

Great place to stay Very friendly and efficient staff. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk and concierge staff were quite helpful. When I needed transportation they had a taxi there right away. They helped make my Chicago trip a great experience. I will stay there again.

NEVER AGAIN. AWful Awful Awful. We love Chicago and will be back but will NEVER STAY HERE AGAINI am writing this at 1AM as my family can not sleep. Our room is 80 degrees and we have a maintenance guy here now looking at the AC. There are no other rooms available so we either have him fix it in the middle of the night or we sweat. In addition to this the ice machine on our floor has never worked. They will charge you 75 per night of your stay for incidentals even though they already have your card number on file but no worries you will get that money back 5 business days after you checkout. After charging you 300 per night plus 75 for incidentals you will not get WiFi. That will cost an additional 10 per day. If you ask an employee a question they will answer politely sometimes lying but offer zero help making sure they toe the company line. Plan was to have a nice long weekend for Fathers Day and our Anniversary. They location is GREAT and they obviously use that to their advantage.

Great girls trip in Chicago. Other reviews mentioned poor plumbing in bathroom and elevators out of order. I was very concerned but luckily had no issues at all during our stay. The room was great and the beds were super comfy. There is a great grocery store next door and the hotel is within walking distance to tons of stuff. We were in room 215 and loved the city lake view. The carpet in the lobby needed to be cleaned. Also the concierge was not friendly or helpful.
Good place to stay for a city trip. Wifi should be complimentary.

Wonderful stay. Wonderful hotel in a great location. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. The staff was super friendly the room was clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel for any family trip.

Graduation. Jef Hughes was the person that made us feel very welcome. The information provided was very helpful and appreciated. Thank you so much Jef for your help and info on vacation information. We will be visiting this hotel on our next visit. Excellent customer service.

Wonderful Hotel in a great location. We enjoyed 2 nights at this hotel. The Doubletree provided wonderful service and great value for the price. This hotel was family friendly and we all felt welcome and comfortable. Will definitely stay here again when coming to Chicago. Close to the Navy Pier and one block from the free shuttle.

Girls Trip. The hotel is within walking distance to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue which made it very convenient for this trip. The hotel could use some updating and a good cleaning. They should not advertise City View as most building are taller then the hotel itself. Also want to point out that rooms do not come with refrigerator or microwave even though I was told there was when reserving the rooms.

Very welcoming and friendly staff. A great hotel for a mother daughter vacation. Close to shopping navy pier the bean and more shopping. Outdoor pool was perfect for a tired teenager to sleep beside. A warm cookie got her out of bed to the airport on time. A great stay.

Excellent location near the Magnificent Mile and the Chicago River. The location was wonderful and it was easy to get around to see the sites. You can walk to many locations. The rooms were nice and well furnished. My only complaint is that the lobby was being renovated while I was there and I was not notified ahead of time. This left our group with no where to meet.

big surprise. This hotel is under renovation. This hotel while having a good location is under a complete renovation. There is no lobby or lobby lobby bar or lobby meeting place. All of that has been completely removed and is apparently being replaced. You enter through a make shift plywood hallway to a temporary check in desk. No notice of this was provided in the hotel description when I booked this hotel I blame this on Expedia. Had I booked it directly through the Hilton website I would have been so notified. Poor job by Expedia on that. I am just glad that I as by myself on a 2day business trip and not with my wife on a Chicago vacation in that case I would have needed to move to another hotel.
Nice hotel close to baby pier. Least expensive hotel in area of business trip was ok room smelled funny due to water leak but was otherwise nice staff were very friendly and helpful.

Great Staff But Average Facility. My wife and I chose this Hilton Hotel because it was close to Navy Pier. We were welcomed by the staff and provided great information by bell staff. Hotel appears to be in the midst of upgrades so seems only functional vs luxurious. Our room was a good size considering Downtown Chicago location. There was mildew in the shower grout and a nicks here and there throughout the bathroom. You could see light around the door frame which permitted external noise into the room. A fraternity group was partying from 1 to 3 in the morning providing the external noise.

See above. They met my requests with the upper floor and close to the elevator so I thank you for that. The hotel was under renovations so it took a long time for the elevators each time. Our room did nt have a fridge and on checkout day the water was cool when we showered. The doorman Ben was very kind by suggesting a place for dinner on the first night. He also hailed us transportation when we were ready. However we were very shocked when we arrived at the restaurant a 7 minute drive with lights and was told 15. We called the driver when we were ready and paid another 15. The next day we used Lfyt and paid a further distance I might add 13 round trip with three people. See above.

Generally fine just disappointed re noise in the room. Nice bar area room was clean and comfortable. Staff amenable. The air conditioner in the room was too loud to leave on at night and there was construction going on inside the hotel that we were not told about. As we were on holiday we were waking late but the drilling and noise started around 8 830 am every morning we were there and could not sleep through it. That was disruptive. Was surprised that I could not figure out how to ring the front desk.

Volleyball tournament nightmare. My daughters volleyball team blocked rooms at Doubletree by Hilton Chicago Mag Mile. By the time all of the games the team dinner was finished we did not get to the hotel until 945 pm. After I got checked in we went up to our room but neither of the keys would work. I ended up having to go down to the front desk 3 separate times because we could not get in to our room. When maintenance finally got the door open he found luggage sleeping guests. The guests ended up being another volleyball family who booked on Expedia. I understand that hotels overbok but why was I given keys to a room that was given away to someone else. Why was the room still under MY name my credit card. We got a lot of I apologize I understand but the best they could do was pay for our room at a different hotel. Gee thanks. Almost 2 hours after checking in to Doubletree an employee walked us down the street to check us in to Embassy Suites. Embassy Suites is highly recommend. Doubletree by hilton Chicago I do NOT recommend at all.

Great location and rare roof top pool. This Gold Coast location is near shopping and many rooms have a slice of the lake to view. The top floors are becoming Hilton Time Share properties and are gorgeous. The roof top pool is loads of fun. The room air conditioning units are unfortunately quite loud. Sleep quality is good but king room could use another comfy chair my spouse and I had to trade off sitting on the bed desk chair or the one comfy chair. Staff throughout the hotel are friendly courteous and professional.

Desk staff were helpful and courteous. The room was spacious. It had a refrigerator. The location was godpol. Pool was closed both days we were there due to private parties. There seemed to be a lack of security and we saw what looked like a potential problem when a group of unregistered guests entered the hotel and hassled the desk clerk. They then proceeded to go up in the elevators. It was disconcerting. The parking fees were high considering we were guests.

Disappointed because the telephone in our room did not work. It was reported and yet no one checked on it. Disappointed in not having internet free service. Disappointed because shampoo conditioner lotion not replaced. Disappointed because extra roll of toilet paper not left. Disappointed because no hot tub. Disappointed because the shallow end of the pool was too deep for a 6 and 7 year old. Disappointed at the cost of parking when staff members told other guests of a cheaper parking close by. We had to leave Sunday morning because of a death in the family. The hotel said that was fine. I would not be charged. I called hotelcom and got a royal run around. Told I could cancel told me 180 would be refunded to me and then some ridiculous scenario of how to receive that refund. I have yet to successfully receive that refund. Extremely disappointed by Doubletree as well as hotelcom.
